Reading Complete pages 200-203 in the My View book. The story this week is 'Why sun & moon live in the sky. It is a Myth. Please watch the video until you understand the story. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BSAknmmJv1M The spelling test for this FRIDAY is the following words: atmosphere brilliant convince endure glance harsh plunge precious swift unite Let‚Äôs Make Our Own Origin Myth! üåè‚ú® These are your Origin Myth titles 1) Jenny - Why did people choose Earth 2) Ian C - Why the elephant has a long trunk 3) Jason - Why are monkeys so smart 4) Jiwoo - Why Orcas are strong and black 5) Jey - How the starts twinkle 6) Noah - Why the Komodo Dragon has strong poison 7) Yujoo - Why - Why are foxes organge 8) Stells - Why do squid have long legs 9) Wj - Why are monkeys swift 10) Siwoo - Why are turtles so slow 11) Ian S - Why does the sun come out in the morning 12) Alex - Why do sea otters wrap seaweed around their bodies Tonights homework You have all made a great start on your origin myths, and I was really impressed with your storytelling. Tonight, begin working on the final draft of your story and start decorating it. It should be presented on one side of an A4 paper so we can display it on the window for others to read. You may type your story and decorate around it, or write it by hand using your best handwriting‚Äîjust make sure it‚Äôs big enough for others to read easily. Tomorrow, you‚Äôll have more time in the first class to continue working on it. I want to see vibrant colors to make your story come to life! You can add stickers, origami, or your own drawings. This will be graded as a project, and the final piece of work should be given to me on Tuesday, the 21st. Example Origin Myths How the Firefly Got Its Light Once, deep in a rainforest dripping with rain and echoing with frogs, there lived a tiny gray beetle who was always ignored. The butterflies showed off their colors, and the bees buzzed proudly about their honey, but the little beetle had nothing special. One night, as he sat sadly by a puddle, a falling star splashed beside him. ‚ÄúYou look dim,‚Äù said the star kindly. ‚ÄúWould you like a bit of my shine?‚Äù The beetle nodded shyly, and the star touched his back. Suddenly, a golden glow burst from the beetle‚Äôs tail! He flew into the night, lighting the forest like a tiny lantern. From that night on, he shared his light with others who felt unseen‚Äîand that‚Äôs how fireflies came to sparkle across the dark forests every summer night. Why Zebras Have Stripes Long ago, zebras were plain white and loved to roll in the mud. One hot day, a zebra found a cool, shiny black rock and lay down on it to rest. When he stood up, black lines covered his back! The other zebras thought he looked amazing and wanted lines too. They rolled and rolled across the rock until their bodies were covered in black stripes. Ever since then, zebras have worn their stripes proudly under the sun. Why the Parrot Has Bright Feathers Long ago, all parrots were gray and dull. They lived quietly in the jungle trees, afraid of being noticed. One day, Rainbow, the sky painter, flew over the forest with buckets of color. She was in such a hurry to finish painting the sunset that she tripped over a tall tree‚Äîand Red, yellow, green, and blue paint rained down on the parrots below! The parrots gasped when they saw their shiny new feathers. They squawked and danced and showed off their bright colors to every animal in the jungle. Rainbow laughed and said, ‚ÄúYou wear my colors better than the sky!‚Äù And ever since that day, parrots have been the most colorful birds in the world. Winter Festival Performance We watched some fun dance videos today to get ideas for our Winter Festival performance. Below are a few of the videos we looked at. These are just for inspiration, so you don‚Äôt need to follow them exactly‚Äîjust watch and get some creative ideas for your moves and energy. You can watch each video at home to think about the style or choreography you like best. (Links will be added below.) Jingle Bell Rock ‚Äî fun and classic Christmas energy (1 minute) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-euxuPOGeEs (1) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kaqgky-tm3A (x2) Need to choose 1 of these! Ballet Section (40 seconds) Carol of the Bells ‚Äî graceful and dramatic ballet-style movement https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kVIMBip5yw Sugar Plum Fairy - Magical, twinkly, gentle https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jSABdMxupMI Bolshoi Ballet | The Nutcracker - Energetic, bouncy, joyful https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1_vP7M0Cock Need to choose 1 of these! Soda Pop ‚Äî upbeat and modern K-pop style (30 seconds) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7doSPNWTAZU (59 sec-1:26sec) Just choose the chorus (30 seconds) Then big ending! Please share any ideas you have so we can have a performance we all enjoy!
